Benevento is located in the Campania region of southern Italy, surrounded by mountains and hills, which creates a favorable environment for agriculture. The fertile soil, moderate climate, and abundant water supply make it an ideal place for growing crops, including olives, grapes, wheat, and vegetables.

The agricultural industry in Benevento is essential to the local economy, as it provides employment and income for many people. The area is known for its production of high-quality wines, such as Falanghina and Aglianico, which are highly regarded in Italy and beyond. The olive oil produced in Benevento is also renowned for its distinctive flavor and aroma.

The agriculture sector in Benevento not only provides direct employment opportunities for farmers but also generates a multiplier effect on other sectors of the economy. For example, local restaurants and food processing companies rely on the supply of fresh produce from the region, which helps to stimulate the economy.

However, the agricultural industry in Benevento faces several challenges, including lack of infrastructure, increasing competition from other agricultural areas, and depletion of water resources due to climate change. Despite these challenges, the agricultural industry remains a vital part of the city's economy, culture, and identity.
